intro: Acroceras sparsum, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, succulent appearance. The plant features small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically linear and arranged in a rosette pattern, adapted to withstand arid conditions. Acroceras sparsum thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland desert regions.
